alert.note: Alert for Adams (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 9:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Indiana, including the following counties, Adams, Blackford, Grant, Jay and Wells. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is diminishing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 857 PM EST, heavy rainfall had ended with areal flooding expected to diminish quickly late this evening. Therefore the flood warning will be allowed to expire as scheduled.Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area earlier today. 1 to 2 inches of rain had fallen in the warned area. - Some locations that have experienced flooding include... Marion, Bluffton, Decatur, Portland, Hartford City, Gas City, Berne, Upland, Ossian, Fairmount, Dunkirk, Albany, Montpelier, Jonesboro, Redkey, Geneva, Sweetser, Markle, Swayzee and Van Buren. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
